data.title: Kansai Hokuriku Area Pass (Electronic EO)
data.meta_description: Explore Japan economically and conveniently with Japan Rail. Book your passes here; Instant Confirmation with 24/7 customer service and easy Same Day collection at Change Airport.
data.text:
About Kansai Hokuriku Area Pass (Electronic EO)

The Kansai Hokuriku Area Pass provides unlimited access on the Hokuriku Shinkansen between Kanazawa and Joetsu Myoko and the Sanyo Shinkansen between Shin-Osaka and Okayama. It also entitles you to unlimited use of the IR Ishikawa Railway, limited express, rapid service and local trains.

This pass is valid for usage within 7 consecutive days.

Product overview:

• This is a rail pass that allows unlimited rides during the valid period in ordinary car reserved seats and non-reserved seats on subject trains, etc. within the free travel sections from Kansai Airport to the Kansai and Hokuriku areas.

Subject trains, etc. (All of these can only be boarded within the free travel sections.):

• Hokuriku Shinkansen (between Tsuruga and Joetsumyoko), JR Lines’ Limited Express trains, and ordinary trains (including Special Rapid and Rapid trains)

* The Tokaido Shinkansen cannot be used. (The Shinkansen between Shin-Osaka and Kyoto cannot be used.)

• Noto Railway, Kyoto Tango Railway, Wakayama Electric Railway, and West Japan JR Bus

• Hapi-Line Fukui, IR Ishikawa Railway, and Ainokaze Toyama Railway when passing through JR lines

* As a special case, when using the JR Etsumihoku Line, Nanao Line, Himi Line, and Johana Line, the Hapi-Line Fukui (between Fukui and Echizen-Hanando), IR Ishikawa Railway (between Kanazawa and Tsubata), and Ainokaze Toyama Railway (between Takaoka and Toyama) may be used as long as the customer passes through without disembarking.

Date of change review: Starting from tickets sold on March 16, 2024 (Saturday)

* If the ticket was purchased before the change, the above subject trains, etc. can be used during the portion of use on and after March 16

Exchange orders that were purchased, and tickets that were reserved or purchased, on or before March 15, 2024, are subject to the following transitional handling.

• For products that can be used on the Hokuriku Line between Tsuruga and Kanazawa, the user may use the Hokuriku Shinkansen (between Tsuruga and Kanazawa) in place of the Hokuriku Line where the ticket was originally valid on and after March 16 without paying an additional charge

within the valid period.

* The section which will be transferred to Hapi-Line Fukui and IR Ishikawa Railway (between Tsuruga and Kanazawa) cannot be used on and after March 16. However, as a special case,when using the JR Etsumihoku Line, the Hapi-Line Fukui (between Fukui and Echizen-Hanando) may be used as long as the customer passes through without disembarking.

We will issue electronic exchange voucher for this pass. Upon booking and successful payment, you will first receive a confirmation email.

The electronic exchange voucher will be issued and emailed to the same email address according to the Collection Date indicated during your booking process.

Before departure, please check your email (including junk mail folder) to ensure that you receive an email with the attachment for the electronic exchange voucher and follow instructions on the email. You will not be able to collect the physical exchange voucher at our Changi Recommends booths.

If in doubt, please email attractions@changirecommends.com.sg during working hours 9am to 6pm (Mon-Fri) before your departure.

Kansai-Hokuriku Area Pass is valid for unlimited travel in the valid area on the map.

Valid trains are below:

- Reserved seats on Bullet Train "SANYO SHINKANSEN" (Shin-Osaka⇔Okayama)

- The pass can be used for the Hello Kitty Shinkansen.

- Reserved seats on Bullet Train "HOKURIKU SHINKANSEN" (Kanazawa⇔Joetsu-Myoko)

- Reserved seats on Express Trains (HARUKA, THUNDERBIRD, KUROSHIO, KOUNOTORI, SUPER HAKUTO (Kyoto⇔Kamigori), etc.)

* The Limited Express KUROSHIO, KOUNOTORI, KINOSAKI, HASHIDATE, and MAIZURU trains are all reserved seating-only. Non-reserved seating is not available. Be sure to reserve seats in advance before boarding the train. Boarding the train without reserving seats in advance will result in a separate Limited Express reserved seat fee.

* A separate fare is required for traveling on SUPER HAKUTO (Kamigori⇔Tottori) and SUPER INABA (Kamigori⇔Tottori)

- Special Rapid Services, Rapid Services, and Local trains on JR-WEST Conventional lines

- The pass is only valid on WEST JAPAN JR BUS route buses within the valid area.

- The pass cannot be used on expressway buses.

* These trains below cannot be used

- Bullet Train "HOKURIKU SHINKANSEN" (Joetsu-Myoko⇔Tokyo)

- Bullet Train "TOKAIDO SHINKANSEN" (Shin-Osaka⇔Tokyo)

- Bullet Train "SANYO SHINKANSEN" (Okayama⇔Hakata)

- The Special Rapid "A Seat" paid seating Service

- Not valid for the IR Ishikawa Railway or the Ainokaze Toyama Railway.

* As a special exception, the pass can be used for the Himi, Johana, or Nanao lines only if the pass-holder does not alight from the IR Ishikawa Railway (Kanazawa⇔Tsubata) or the Ainokaze Toyama Railway (Takaoka⇔Toyama).

Limited express trains can be used on the IR Ishikawa Railway (Kanazawa⇔Tsubata).

If using the Ainokaze Liner rapid service on the Ainokaze Toyama Railway, a separate "liner fare" is required.
